meanings.definition: To take something away from someone
meanings.sent1: The teacher will deprive the students of recess if they misbehave.
meanings.sent2: The thief tried to deprive the old lady of her purse.
meanings.sent3: I will deprive myself of dessert to stick to my diet.
meanings.sent4: The storm will deprive us of electricity for hours.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules deprive the employees of any flexibility.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from having or using something
meanings.sent1: The lock on the door will deprive intruders of entry.
meanings.sent2: The bad weather may deprive us of our beach day.
meanings.sent3: I will deprive my dog of treats until he learns to behave.
meanings.sent4: Her busy schedule deprives her of quality time with her family.
meanings.sent5: The closed road will deprive us of our usual shortcut.
